main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified objects were reported in Milan and Green City, Missouri on various dates in 1953 and 1956.
interesting points: Two sets of four bright lights in a diamond formation were observed moving rapidly over Milan and Green City, Missouri, at a high estimated speed of 800 to 1000 mph.
A civilian driver reported sighting a round, silvery-colored object hovering in the air at a very high altitude, which then accelerated at tremendous speed and disappeared within seconds.
The sightings were observed by multiple witnesses, including a woman and her two children, as well as William Springett, a civilian driver.

The investigating officers concluded one sighting was caused by a high altitude, high-speed vehicle, probably astronomical, and that another object seen was not one of the weather balloons normally used.
The document includes details from an Air Intelligence Information Report, signed by different officers including Lieutenant Laurent Q. Wotton and Captain Robert Morrison.
sighted object: bright lights in a diamond formation and a round, silvery-colored object
